derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from medieval Latin praesidentia, from praesidere 'sit before' (see preside)

entry.tran: 总统职位；总裁职位；主席职位
entry.def: The presidency of a country or organization is the position of being the president or the period of time during which someone is president.

example.ex: Britain will support him as a candidate for the presidency of the organisation...

example.ex: Poverty had declined during his presidency.
example.tran: 在他担任总统期间，贫困人口减少了。

Sentence.sentence: Amusa, who is traveling to India this spring to finish a book, then to Senegal to teach English, has ongoing conversations with her friends about how the Obama presidency has changed their daily lives and hopes to put some of those ideas, along with her global perspective, into her posts.
Whether America is going to change during Obama's presidency
Obama's presidency viewed from a global perspective.

sentences.en: Roosevelt was elected four times to the presidency of the United States.

sentences.en: During his presidency many changes took place.
